NoteText:
Doing Alice's 1040, I realized how much money she had in cash and CDs--about $580k--and recommended she put essentially all of it into managed accounts.  After listening to my presentation, she's agreed.
Background:  Retired 1997, became fanatical day-trader.  Greatly surprised self by turning small nest egg into several $M thru September of 2006.  Equally fanatical reader of Harry Dent, saw crash coming.  In September '06, pulled out of stocks, invested in bonds.  Became my tax client, 2009.  As her bonds have matured, she's bought new ones; that money--est. $2.53 million--is intact.  No other RR.

Eliza Black called to ask who was a good financial advisor at Reliable.  I proposed myself (and Jim), of course.  She's now Mrs. Henry Ward Beecher.  She and the Reverend Hank can come in this afternoon at 1.

Met w/ Eliza and Hank (Rev. Henry Ward Beecher).  On Feb. 3, he inherited half a small grocery store and a neighboring weed-patch from his dad (Lyman Beecher) down in American Fork, along with a money-market fund of $50,000.  Next meet, M, 2/19, 12:30.
Background:  Hank is pastor of Plymouth Congregational here in Ditchwater.  Eliza is "just a homemaker"--with a taxing duty as the preacher's wife.  They have never had any children.
Hank's widowed sister, Harriet Beecher Stowe, owns the other half of the store and manages it, as she did for their father.  --SAB

The Beechers have agreed to max out their IRAs and start a 403(b).  We've invested the remaining $36k in an annuity--lots of fund choices, so that *when* the time is right, I can move them into U.S. small caps.  Neither Jim nor I feels that it's time yet to go back into U.S. equities big-time.  NOTE:  The Beechers do NOT want to be invested overseas!

On Friday, March 19, BPExxonMobilAmoco offered to buy the weedpatch lot neighboring the Jiffy Mart for a gas station.  Harriet Stowe was considering additional store parking.  By early next month, she and the Beechers should decide whether to make a counter-offer to $37,500.
The Beechers and Mrs. Stowe are still deciding whether to make a counter-offer to BPExxonMobilAmoco's $37,500 for their vacant lot.  The station would be one of their new type.
Mike B., who decorated our office walls, wants to "see what we could do for his money" now that he's about to turn 30.  Appt., Tues, 2/2, 3:30 pm.

Discussed options.  Correct spelling is Michelangelo L. Buonarroti, but always called Mike.
Professional house-painter (inside & out).  Does murals on the side--and gets pretty good prices!  Most recent one, in a club on west 2nd South, brought in $20k.  Also taking sculpture classes at SLCC.
Has about $30k in a mish-mash of stocks, funds, bonds, money-market accounts, and CDs.  Some seriously hammered by the late unpleasantness, others not.

Transferred in about $42k (not 30), added $2k to IRA from savings & checking.
Badly wants to keep on owning individual stocks.  So we've let him keep some MSoft (down from $48 to $12.4) and BGM (up by 24% to $12.5 on announcement of a new product).  Everything else in LatAm and Japanese funds.
Background:  I asked him why he's in house-painting when his real love is art.  His father told him, "Artists are laborers, no better than shoemakers," and Mike figures he can combine two or more trades!  "You're a Renaissance man," said Jim, and Mike laughed.

Until today, Uncle Rob has invested exclusively through Danny D. Foe, who yesterday retired from Reliable.
This morning, Rob's suddenly thrown me $100k even--in cash--"just to see what my little girl can do"!  So okay, I *will!*
Have put Rob mostly into overseas funds, as I've been doing with most clients these days, balanced with Treasuries.  Called and told him so.

They've agreed to reposition their IRAs--total $90k, down 42%!--in a portfolio of T-bills, bonds, and some small-cap stock funds in Japan.
Adele prefers e-mail.  But anything just for Croc can go to the fax at the garage.

Called to get Croc's $5,000 IRA contribution and a spousal $5,000 from Adele.  She wanted to put in more, but I pointed out that $6K was the current maximum tax-deductible.  So we opened education IRAs of $2,000 each for Ali and Liz.
Our Prospect Judge Bernhardt has referred Dr. Albert Einstein.  Says he's not happy with his advisor back East.

Bert never hears from his advisor back East, so wants "everything"--$2.4 million in various U.S. equity funds--transferred to account with us.
Receives substantial royalties quarterly on some inventions, about $250K a year.
P.S.  Turns out to be Velda Oldebucks' brother!

Gwen F. of Avalon Caterers phoned to ask if she can open an account.  Told her, "If you've got the money, I've got the time!"  Needs "a few days" to get money transferred, so set for Th.
Background:  Rex gave me his business card at the supermarket last December, and we had them cater our January "Grand Opening."
Check for $500,000 drawn on the Royal Bank of Britain. Discussed possibilities, goals, etc.   Next appt., W, 2/3, 2:30.
Check cleared fine.  Letting RC "Acct Set Up" letter be printed.  Appt., W, 2/3/10, 2:30.
No Treasuries for this forward-looking pair!  We put their $500k in an annuity so it can be moved around without tax consequences.  Investments are Latin America and Japan.

Steve and Susie have an underfunded Keogh for him and a maxed-out education IRA for Johnny--his various grandparents contributed most of the funds, though Steve's in charge of it.  The lawsuit settlement should be $170 million x 1/3 = $56.67 million.
Background:  Susies's a prominent community leader, knows everybody in town, young and old.  Should be a good source of referrals!
Got hold of Susie today.  Got a bunch of background info and nothing else.

Came to our Client/Guest seminar with Steve and Susie Decatur.  Asked to be called today to set appt.
Mr. & Mrs. Hawthorne would be "well pleased" to meet with us, he says, F, 2/26, 2 pm.
Background from Decaturs:  Nathaniel "Thorny" Hawthorne writes some sort of engineering books, VERY successful.

For a couple of months, she's been seeing our "Reliable Securities--Ditchwater--As Reliable as Ever" office sign.  Today, she decided that she wanted some reliable *local* advice!
Right now, Goldbug Sacks manages most of her money.  She wants to invest $100,000 with us, "to start with."   Set appt.

Met.  Placed $100K in a managed portfolio of high-quality corporate bonds paying 9.5%.
She says she'll see how we do with it, and then she may be able to recommend some people she knows, or invest some more with us, or both.
Over the weekend, Hank Beecher was playing golf with a Dr. Adam Smith and recommended Sue and Jim.  Hank says the doctor wants an appointment to "consider getting into some U.S. investments."

Brought wife, Eve Jones--"but you can just call us the Smiths!" she says.
The Smiths' investments are basically divided between an advisor in Buenos Aires, a Sr. David Ricardo, and one in Tokyo, Milt Friedman.  They like the idea of advisors "so close to home," and are trying us out with $500k.
Background:  A few years ago, Adam and Eve sold "Paradise," their expensive Park City home, having built an even more expensive chalet-style place several miles uphill outside Ditchwater.  They have discussed the possibility of either or both retiring, but "we don't really mean it, you know.  We both enjoy our work too much!" 
Nevertheless, just the interest from their investments would probably keep them in style.

More background, from 'Net *and* interview notes:  Adam is a brain-surgeon and neurologist.  He'd been well known among North American physicians for decades before he became world-famous, for restoring Alan Greenspan to reasonable health after the stroke that "The Chairman" suffered on Black Friday.
His first wife, Lilith, remarried decades ago, so no alimony problem.
Eve, his long-time second wife, makes about $50K a year from illustrating children's books under her own name, Eve Jones.
Jim and I had a pleasant meeting with Mom, and afterwards we went shopping.
Called Bitsy to do annual portfolio reallocation with Sue.  Says it will *have* to be tomorrow, since she leaves on Saturday:  Flying to Burma.
Conference call to Bitsy--Sue, Jewel, and me--just to say Hi!
Met, signed the papers, shook hands with Jim, and they were gone!

On Saturday, she came to our Client/Guest seminar on Mike Buonarroti's arm.
Both she and husand ("Poldy"?) need to attend any final meeting.  Asked for initial appt., T, 2/23, 3:30 pm.
Molly "adores" our proposal, with a few minor modifications, and is certain that Leo will too.  Had Chip print two revised copies, will 2-day one off to Leo in Kentucky.
Molly is unexpectedly filling in for singer in L.A. Rescheduled appt.
Put off meeting again, rescheduled.
Leo's stuck in Dublin for the rest of the month.  Re-re-reschedule for RIGHT after he gets back!  Call Molly Th, 4/29, 3:15 pm (phone appt!) to get soonest good day to meet--or to call back *again.*

Sarah and Alfred already made their IRA contributions in January.  Next meeting, 4/7, 2 pm, our office, just Sarah.
Sarah is definitely the decision maker.
Very intelligent questions about the proposal.  Has taken it home to study.  Says she'll call for next appointment.

Never called us about appt., so I called her. Came to seminar, but she wasn't ready to jump then, and she isn't now.  (She *really* likes keeping track of her T-bills!)  I'm guessing the Einstein referral was motivated partly by guilt over taking up our time.
P&M and Monthly Drip may bring the Judge around yet.

Saw sign, liked name "Reliable Securities."  Asked for "man in charge"; surprised but courteous when introduced to me.  He owns Wasatch Furs Emporiums in Salt Lake, Ditchwater, and Moab.
We discussed his portfolio's performance the last few years.  I encouraged greater diversification.  He won't commit to anything--except another meeting--yet.  Says he wants to be sure he's right before he goes ahead.  Appt., M, 3/15, 2 pm.

Not as shrewd an investor as he thinks he is, but did ask good questions about our proposal, seems to understand it.  Took it home to show Betsy.  I explained we'd need both signatures "for legal purposes."  Appt. with both of them, T, 3/23, 3 pm.
Cancelled appt.  Has to leave town, "gone until spring, several weeks."  Couldn't get anything more specific from him.
Mrs. C. says "Davy's still on the trail," suggests I try back in a couple of weeks.  No, she most certainly does NOT "handle the family financial decisions"!
Betsy says he's due back Thursday for sure.  But don't call back until Monday, May 3; Davy won't be selling or buying anything the first couple of weeks he's home . . .
Mom's signed up to go to Beijing China.  She'll e-mail the exact dates and hotel address, just in case she absolutely HAS to sign anything.

E-mail from Mom in Kyoto.  She just met Rudyard Kipling, the distinguished foreign-desk editor/writer for the Salt Lake Tribune, at an awards banquet there.  After he gets back to Utah, I need to contact him about his investments.  Managing his money himself "isn't fun any more."
His mother, Britannia, is 91 and in frail health.  She lives with him, has a live-in nurse to take care of her when her son's away.  He manages her investments, too.
Good address and phone info on both, *and* their birthdates--Mom IS a marvel!--but no indication whatever of what they're invested in.

Our first lead from Bob's e-mail/direct-mail, announcing we've joined the Chamber of Commerce.  ("You've got to have *some* hook," he said.  And since he's a graduate of the BGM Sales Assistant Boot Camp . . .)
She's the pastor of The Little Church in the Desert, not too far outside of town.  Says she expects to have some church funds to invest soon, and probably some personal money as well.  Wants to meet today.

Birthday is January 13.  Asked me, "Were you thinking of getting me a present?" and laughed.  Won't state birth year.  Sue told her she'd have to when and if we opened an account.  "Well, honey, that will be time enough!"   She wants her deacon to meet us, so next appt. at the church rectory.

Called to cancel appt.  Church Board of Elders WILL have to approve her dealing with us.  Unfortunately, one of the 3 Elders is laid up in ICU for several days.  Told her to call when she can set appt.
Chris and Amy ready for an appointment!!!

Amy arrived alone for the meeting; Chris couldn't tear himself away from an assignment.  Got most of what we need from her.  Jim's agreed to meet Chris tonight at the Port O' Call for some additional info, schmoozing.  Appt., F, 5/14, 3 pm.
Background:  No kids.  --SAB
PM, at Port o' Call.  Got questions answered by Chris.  Discussed direction of current stocks, why he and Amy might want Keoghs.

Susie Decatur called.  She's recommended us to Beatrice Portinari, her friend from many community activities.  Trish's husband is Prof. Dante Alighieri.
Both in their 50s and have been looking at his pension plan, their Social Security, and whatever other investments they've got.
Spoke to Dante's secretary; was expecting call.  Checked Susie's spellings of both names with him; they ARE correct.  Set appt. Th, 3/4, 4 pm.

Completely approve proposal, but refuse to start implementing plan until first CD matures.  They figure they'd better hang onto their whole small savings account "until we figure out our taxes."  Jim told them he'd be "honored" to do those for them, no additional charge.  Appt for that, T, 3/16, 4 pm.  Appt. when $30k CD matures, W, 5/26/10, 2 pm.

Collected data.
Next week, she's leaving on a business trip to France and Poland; may need an extended stay.  Call clinic "any time the last week of April," talk to Pete.  Should be able to set appt. for *some* date in May.

Archie tells me he has a franchise operation, a string of bars each called "Archie's Place"--mostly in Wyoming, but the first one is right here on Main Street in Ditchwater.  Wants to set up 401(k)s, to have IRA advice available to his employees, and to consider his own retirement--not necessarily at 65.
They've taken home their personal proposal and the 401k/IRA material to review before appt., W, 5/5, 4:00 pm.
Her confirmation of M, 4/19, 4 pm appt. arrived, with her thanks.

Collected personal info.  She was heading for the door when she sprang it on us that she's also interested in setting up 401(k)s for her employees.  We'll discuss that at the same appt.
Background:  A bit deaf from gunfire.
Theatrical Enterprises of Ditchwater is a partnership, Kate Padovana and Pete Veronese, married to each other.  Appt., F, 4/16, 2 pm.

Investments consist solely of $2K in CDs and an excessively large savings account.  When they got out of the stock market--"precisely a week too late" according to Pete--they stashed the results in their savings, until they could decide what to do with the money.  "Today, I suppose, we at last decide!" Kate declared dramatically--of course.  Appt., T, 4/20, 4 pm.  (Better to come after Bitsy's party than before!)
Background:  NY stage actors for nearly 10 years each.  Came back to Utah four years ago wanting to be "comparatively big fish in a much smaller pond."  Have succeeded artistically, and "sometimes even financially."
Kate has told us her actual birthdate "in strictest confidence, you understand.  In all my publicity, I'm absolutely ageless, of course!"
Pete and Kate are unexpectedly flying to New York tonight for the rest of the week, so can't make it tomorrow.  Rescheduled appt., confirmation call, & checklist review.  Set up confirmation letter.

[DUPLICATE from Oakley--personal CG:]  Collected personal info.  She was heading for the door when she sprang it on us that she's also interested in setting up 401(k)s for her employees.  We'll discuss that at the same appt.

Same appt. date as for Annie's personal proposal won't work.  Have set up separate corporate appt.
Also now have names, birthdates, SSNs, and e-mails for ALL corporate officers.  Annie says Major and Colonel titles are "just show-biz, but the boys like 'em."  And yes, Mrs. Canary-Burke does prefer using her own first names with her hyphenated last name.
Dividing CG into two:  Personal (Business Owner) and Wild West Circuses (Corporate).  Annie seems to be the corporate decision-maker, too.

June 8 - 27, Bitsy will be at The Great Wall Hilton
Phone:  (86)(10) 6590-0000
Fax: (86)(10) 6590-0002
Received letter from Hester.  She will be in Boston area June 6 - 22:  Custom House Hotel, 54 Turner St., Salem, MA 01970
Faxed us that their spring vacation at their Biarritz villa, on the French CÃ´te d'Argent, will be 5/5 - 26 this year.
She likes us! Wants ALL her accounts transferred from A.G. Merrill Webber Brothers.  Jewel is on it already; shouldn't take over 2 weeks.
Called Mutual Funds at A.G. Merrill Webber Brothers.  Have received papers, transfer should be no problem.
NO accounts transferred yet, so called AGMWB Mutual Funds.  Say no difficulties, claim should be no problem, but if not complete by Friday, CB.
Still no accounts transferred.  AGMWB Mutual Funds gave me same line as before, asked me CB again 4/20.
Still no transfer, still same line.  CB again F, they say!
Agreed with Velda that AGMWB are dragging their feet.  Not even one account transferred yet!
Still nothing.  AGMWB now claiming "unusual volume of transfers."  I'll CB again next week.
Overseas Fund transferred to Reliable from AGMWB.  Called Velda to inform, told her would check up on rest Tuesday.

There was an ad for CDs in Velda's statement from 2nd National, which reminded her that she already has a 5-year CD with them.  "About a quarter of a million, dear, plus whatever the interest is.  I think it matures in November or December this year."  Wanted to know if she should roll it over or what.  Told her somebody would call today or tomorrow and discuss it with her.

Matures 11/10/10.  Told Velda I'd put the CD into our database, so that I'd be sure to call her in October and we can decide what to do with it then!  Mentioned I'd send her a letter to confirm.
P.S.  She's taking a "flying trip" to the Grand Canyon.  Leaves Th, back M, May 2nd.
Have set Opportunity Review Interval down to 90 days, just in case Sue hasn't discussed anything with Rob before then.
They live on his quarterly royalty checks from Wonderbook Publishing, of which about $10,000 is usually available for investment.  We'll be putting the first $10K into an annuity.

Trish has been thoroughly frightened about their financial future.  Their investments are virtually all fixed-income, some at lousy rates and others at really lousy rates.
We assured them that their assets could be more fruitfully invested, gave some concrete examples.  Very interested.
Wants appointment to invest divorce settlement--after he gets it in July.  Have just set it!

Accounts set up, papers signed.  Alice is decision-maker of couple, legal owner of all investments.
Background:   Smitty is essentially worthless financially.  Has teacher's pension tied up in court.
Refuses to share his wife's money (exc. modest checking account), but Alice wants him "kept informed."
No CHANCE of anything on pension for at least 6 months!  Condo MIGHT move by July, at best.
Really need to get Alice more diversified.  Call about that in a couple of months!
Are selling, but tied up in escrow at LEAST thru June.
Came with Croc and Adele Dundee to our Client/Prospect seminar last Saturday night.  Gave us excellent marks on our Seminar Report Card, and asked for appointment.

At the gym, Steve Decatur set appt. for tomorrow.
Background:  Steve has a struggling law practice in our building.  No expectations for any of the family money until decades from now.  About a year and a half ago, Steve won a class-action contingency case against a pig farm in central Utah; he should get one-third of a pretty big settlement SOMEday.
See today's Hawthorne Note.
Called Mutual Funds at AGMWB *again,* to see what's taking so long with remaining accounts.  FINALLY becoming apologetic!!!
Leo's investment strategy has been to read the lead article in a current investment magazine and put his money wherever it recommends.  Total est. value, $2.2M.
Wants "info about personal financial planning."  Sending it.
Sent e-mail.  STILL no response this afternoon.  But got Internet postcard looking forward to meeting w/ us--NOT mentioning our email!
Chris and Amy came with Rev. Beecher, Amy's pastor, to our first (and so far only) Client/Guest seminar.  Won't set an appt. yet, but insist are very interested!
Still can't or won't set appt.--but still absolutely LOVED us and the seminar!  Don't think they're sincere enough to waste postage on, but won't downgrade ... yet.
The Doctors Curie run a nuclear-medicine clinic, The Radiology Institute of Utah.  Actually, I caught Dr. Marie at the lab, but they prefer business messages at the clinic.

Looks like our first Client!  When I took my car in this morning, I told Croc what Sue and I are doing.  He's really unhappy with his Avante Garde IRA.  Set appt. for this evening.
Background:  Croc had planned to retire at 50, in 12 years, but the index funds haven't been doing well.
Called us to refer Dr. Albert Einstein.  See his record.
Deacon Wilkes never showed.  Neither did any solid financial papers.

Annie Oakley at Wild West Circuses, Inc., responding to our broadcast e-mail, says she's 77 and intends to "die in harness."  Asks us to choose one of five date-time combinations listed for appointment and send her directions to our office.
Have just e-mailed back for M, 4/19, 4 pm.  Attached files of map and of Reliable's "What to Bring to Your First Consultation."

In a long, chatty message, they mention they've been invited to the 4th of July celebration at the French Embassy in D.C.  Have responded briefly, pleading hurry.
BUT:  Be sure to congratulate them on the invite sometime!
Alice and Smitty own a condo together in St. George. They've had it on the market and hope to sell and close by September.  They "just thought we ought to know"!  Am adding to Cond. Opp. for pension.

PROBLEM:  About 2 weeks ago, suddenly stopped receiving any mailings from Reliable. When I checked, was told he's not in the Reliable database!  Frankly, I don't believe it; suspect data-entry kid can't spell but won't admit it!  Have set PROBLEM Action.

PROBLEM:  Young Nat called.  Annuity statement just arrived, now addressed to "Mr. and Mrs. Nathaniel Hawthorne, Jr."!  Nat is greatly amused; his Dad isn't.  I called VB Annuities, got a runaround about a change-of-address at USPS.  Bottom line, "Tiffy won't be in until Wednesday week."  Setting PROBLEM Action.
Let her know we're working on it, and are confident we'll make it happen eventually!
No difficulties.  Delighted with all arrangements!
Hank has a "dreadful cold."  Called in to check whether it's hit here.
In Qamun-i-Khado, Afghanistan, for a couple of weeks.  Ass't says he mentioned our letter!  CB W, 5/26, 2 pm, @ office.
Let Adele know NO problems with transfer.  She was pleased, said she'd tell Croc.
This is a note
